title: Wesley Bell
deleted: In October of 2019, Bell charged Dawan Ferguson with two counts of statutory rape and two counts of statutory sodomy and child molestation. The allegations stem from the disappearance of Ferguson’s son Christian in 2003.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Currier |first1=Joel |title=St. Louis County prosecutors file sex charges against man accused of killing disabled son in 2003 |url=https://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/st-louis-county-prosecutors-file-sex-charges-against-man-accused/article_7994159a-c32f-5338-89a4-7c93f11a858c.html |accessdate=22 February 2020 |publisher=The St. Louis Post Dispatch |date=October 24, 2019}}</ref> Ferguson’s public defender filed a motion to dismiss the case, arguing that the case was politically-motivated.  She cited Ferguson’s ex-wife working for Bell’s campaign for prosecutor and donating money to Bell as proof of this assertion.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Currier |first1=Joel |title=St. Louis County man accused of killing disabled son in 2003 stays in jail; prosecutors plan more charges |url=https://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/st-louis-county-man-accused-of-killing-disabled-son-in/article_eef4f402-7b1f-5511-bfd0-6574f01fa6cd.html |accessdate=22 February 2020 |publisher=The St. Louis Post Dispatch |date=October 23, 2019}}</ref>

title: Wesley Bell
deleted: On October 29, 2020 one of Bell's assistant prosecutors filed a lawsuit under Missouri's Human Rights Act claiming that Bell had fired her and forced out five other female attorneys in favor of male employees. The lawsuit further alleged that Bell had created a hostile work environment for female attorneys at the office. Bell responded by claiming that the prosecutor's attorney was irresponsibly and unethically attempting to litigate his case in the media. <ref>{{cite web |last1=Currier |first1=Joel |title=Former prosecutor accuses Wesley Bell of racial, gender and age discrimination |url=https://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/former-prosecutor-accuses-wesley-bell-of-racial-gender-and-age-discrimination/article_8df1057b-4d8b-5622-8ffd-fa21a5a62216.html |website=St. Louis Post Dispatch |accessdate=10/29/2020}}</ref>
